text:
Hi,
for Tomcat 3 I have observed that running Tomcat as a NT service is 1.5 times 
faster than as a console application. I assume that the behavior for Tomcat 4 
is the same. So the possibility to install Tomcat 4 as NT service would be nice.

Best regards

Thomas Mäsing
creator: thomas2.maesing@bgs-ag.de

text:
This functionality is already present, although it's provided through another
OSS project (JavaService -
http://www.alexandriasc.com/software/JavaService/index.html).
The Windows installer has an option to set it up for you.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
Hi,
I have just tested the JavaService. The following I have observed:

Running my test case with Tomcat as a console application provides a equivalent 
performance for Tomcat 3.2.3, 3.3a and 4.0.1..

Running Tomcat as a service Tomcat 3.2.3 and 3.3a are 50% faster than Tomcat 
4.0. But for the versions 3.2.3 and 3.3a I have used jk_nt_service.exe to 
install the services.

So I have done another test. I have compared Tomcat 3.3a services installed 
either with JavaService.exe and jk_nt_service.exe. 

The service installed with JavaService.exe runs 50% slower than the one 
installed with jk_nt_servive.exe.

So I reopend the bug to suggest a solution with jk_nt_service.exe because no
user will accept a performance decrease of 50%.

Best regards

Thomas
creator: thomas2.maesing@bgs-ag.de
remm@apache.org
text:
Running TC as a service or not makes no difference in performance, which is
normal (the same code is executed).
